header.title: British Bangladeshi pupils from London miss the UK
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: As Bangladesh marks 40 years of independence, BBC Asian Network has been looking at the the links between the UK and the country.. . More than 90% of British Bangladeshis comes from the region of Sylhet in the north-east of the country - and remittances pour into the economy there from migrants who live in the UK.. . One way in which British Bangladeshis try to hold on to their links is by sending their British-born children to school there.. . Pupils are taught the British curriculum and children born in the UK are dotted among those in the classroom.

Im just trying to promote my new channel lego friends in English and Bengali, but I am so sad for watching this!! I actually have tears, why would parents give birth and then separate themselves from their kids in the name of better upbringing? This is their job, but if you really want the Bangladeshi culture then really as a family they should have all gone together. No this is not right, even when I go for a few weeks I can tell you its not easy to live there when you go from London, the longest Ive stayed is 8months just wanted Bangladeshi lifestyle, and I can tell you I got a once in a lifetime lesson, never again. Its sad because I do like Bangladesh. Poor boys I will pray for you guys tonight, I have children and the pain I felt in your words too real.
I always wanted to be educated in Bangladesh but my parents didn't let me afraid of losing their council house.

Anyway final thing, Bangali parents love chatting shit to you , about stuff, i gave EVERY1 FACTS, so dont be pissed or upset ESPECIALLY FRESHY'S also if u still are a hater, then there is nothing much i can do, except tell you to go and stay at a Hostel for a year , then u will know what i mean. if you still hate then theres something wrong with or u have a vendetta against me. conclusion : this is a heads up for young bangalis who are about to go this country, u might be at risk.also APERECIATE
